project.teaser: Europe has been in the forefront for research and innovation, even though at different paces depending on specific location. In this context, ACCELERO – Accelerating Local Innovation Ecosystems in Europe aims at contributing to reverse the unbalanced business activity in...
project.objective: Europe has been in the forefront for research and innovation, even though at different paces depending on specific location. In this context, ACCELERO – Accelerating Local Innovation Ecosystems in Europe aims at contributing to reverse the unbalanced business activity in Europe by increasing the attractiveness of (less advanced) ecosystems: making ‘modest’ and ‘moderate’ innovation ecosystems more attractive to local startups that will benefit from a strong local support and avoid relocation to EU hubs as well to international companies interested in setting up their businesses outside the established and well-known centres. It also aims at tapping into the potential of local ecosystems through co-designed programmes of activities proposed jointly by business acceleration entities located in less connected innovation ecosystems (‘modest’ and ‘moderate’) and innovation hubs (‘strong innovators’ and innovation leaders’), to improve the quality of business acceleration services, their network outreach and scale-up support. ACCELERO has the ambition of creating a pan-European community of business support organisations (BSOs) as the one-stop shop for all BSOs and its “customers”, the startups and SMEs, as well as for peer-to-peer exchange, networking and connectedness for all stakeholders engaged in the broader innovation ecosystem. This will be achieved with an initial ACCELERO extended community apart from consortium members to co-create and pilot-test high-quality business acceleration services with European BSOs from emerging and moderate innovators together with experts from strong and leader innovation regions or Member States, followed by the launch of the community inside Euroquity platform.
project.title: Accelerating Local Innovation Ecosystems in Europe

article.title: Paving the way for European innovation

result.title: Impact assessment methodology
result.description: Methodology note on the data collection and impact analysis of the implementation of the pilots.

result.title: Methodology note on the selection procedure
result.description: This deliverable corresponds to a 2-pager methodology note on the selection procedure of participants in the exchange programmes.

result.title: Pool of materials, tools and coaches profile made available via ACCELERO’s platform
result.description: It shall include all existing materials webinars and online courses pool of expert and coaches and best practices specific challenges

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: This document will provide further detail and clarification on the use management and methods for the generated data

result.title: Consolidated pilot test report
result.description: Results, conclusions, and policy recommendations from the pilot tests

result.title: Individualised road mappings of co-created services
result.description: These roadmaps shall contain the main characteristics of the newly created service, an implementation roadmap, and extra features such as the needed infrastructure, network, and expertise required for its implementation. It will also include a simplified user-journey to promote a higher level of engagement and increase efficiency of the service delivery. This document will have a total length of maximum 5 pages.

result.title: Report on cross-validation and analysis of co-created services
result.description: Provide insights for European BSOs, especially the ones located in emerging and moderate innovation ecosystems on the current scenario of needs and gaps and specific services and resources adding value to their existing offer.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - ACCELERO (Accelerating Local Innovation Ecosystems in Europe)
result.teaser: The ACCELERO project strengthened regional innovation ecosystems across Europe by improving business acceleration services, particularly in emerging and moderate innovator regions. The project directly addressed the uneven distribution of innovation resources in Europe by...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Dissemination and exploitation plan
result.description: This deliverable comprises the goals strategy tools channels and KPIs concerning the dissemination and exploitation of the project

result.title: Report on needs analysis of selected LEBs
result.description: Qualitative analysis report on the data collected from the needs analysis on service performance to start-ups/SMEs and connection to EU ecosystem from LEBs gathered from 1-1 interviews with each selected LEB

result.title: Detailed open call text and selection process
result.description: Text of the open call to select Local Ecosystem Builders including all relevant information on the application and selection process as well as on the specific activities in which these partners will benefit and the terms of engagement

result.title: Concept note for evaluation of LEBs service maturity
result.description: The deliverable will describe the approach to evaluate the LEBs using EBN Monitoring & Evaluation tools.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
